caption: SCIM
description: The System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) Configuration object provides a structured set of attributes related to SCIM protocols used for identity provisioning and management across cloud-based platforms. It standardizes user and group provisioning details, enabling identity synchronization and lifecycle management with compatible Identity Providers (IdPs) and applications. SCIM is defined in RFC-7634
name: scim

auth_protocol.description: The authorization protocol as defined by the caption of auth_protocol_id. In the case of Other, it is defined by the event source.

auth_protocol_id.description: The normalized identifier of the authorization protocol used by the SCIM resource.

created_time.description: When the SCIM resource was added to the service provider.

error_message.caption: Last Error Message
error_message.description: Message or code associated with the last encountered error.

is_group_provisioning_enabled.caption: SCIM Group Provisioning Enabled
is_group_provisioning_enabled.description: Indicates whether the SCIM resource is configured to provision groups, automatically or otherwise.

is_user_provisioning_enabled.caption: SCIM User Provisioning Enabled
is_user_provisioning_enabled.description: Indicates whether the SCIM resource is configured to provision users, automatically or otherwise.

last_run_time.caption: Last Sync Time
last_run_time.description: Timestamp of the most recent successful synchronization.

modified_time.description: The most recent time when the SCIM resource was updated at the service provider.

name.description: The name of the SCIM resource.

protocol_name.caption: Supported Protocol
protocol_name.description: The supported protocol for the SCIM resource. E.g., SAML, OIDC, or OAuth2.

rate_limit.description: Maximum number of requests allowed by the SCIM resource within a specified time frame to avoid throttling.

state.description: The provisioning state of the SCIM resource, normalized to the caption of the state_id value. In the case of Other, it is defined by the event source.

state_id.description: The normalized state ID of the SCIM resource to reflect its activation status.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The provisioning state of the SCIM resource is unknown.

1.caption: Pending
1.description: The SCIM resource is Pending activation or creation.

2.caption: Active
2.description: The SCIM resource is in an Active state, or otherwise enabled.

3.caption: Failed
3.description: The SCIM resource is in a Failed state.

4.caption: Deleted
4.description: The SCIM resource is in a Deleted state, or otherwise disabled.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The provisioning state of the SCIM resource is not mapped. See the state attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

vendor_name.caption: Service Provider
vendor_name.description: Name of the vendor or service provider implementing SCIM. E.g., Okta, Auth0, Microsoft.

uid.description: A unique identifier for a SCIM resource as defined by the service provider.

uid_alt.caption: External ID
uid_alt.description: A String that is an identifier for the resource as defined by the provisioning client. The externalId may simplify identification of a resource between the provisioning client and the service provider by allowing the client to use a filter to locate the resource with an identifier from the provisioning domain, obviating the need to store a local mapping between the provisioning domain's identifier of the resource and the identifier used by the service provider.

url_string.caption: SCIM Endpoint URL
url_string.description: The primary URL for SCIM API requests.
